The `{htmlwidgets}` package should just work! These examples are taken from the [`htmlwidgets` documentation](https://www.htmlwidgets.org).

::::{.cr-section}

Here's one type of widget... @cr-widget-leaflet

... that is a map! @cr-widget-leaflet

:::{#cr-widget-leaflet}

:::{#fig-leaflet}

```{r}
#| fig-caption: This is a great map!
library(leaflet)

leaflet() |>
  addTiles() |>
  setView(-93.65, 42.0285, zoom = 17) |>
  addPopups(-93.65, 42.0285, "Here is the <b>Department of Statistics</b>, ISU")
```
:::

:::

And another. This one's a scene rendered with `{rgl}`. @cr-widget-rgl

:::{#cr-widget-rgl}
```{r}
library(rgl)
library(htmltools)

theta <- seq(0, 6 * pi, len = 100)
xyz <- cbind(sin(theta), cos(theta), theta)
lineid <- plot3d(xyz, type = "l", alpha = 1:0, lwd = 5, col = "blue")["data"]

browsable(tagList(
  rglwidget(elementId = "example", width = 500, height = 400,
    controllers = "player"),
  playwidget("example", 
    ageControl(births = theta, ages = c(0, 0, 1), objids = lineid,
      alpha = c(0, 1, 0)), start = 1, stop = 6 * pi, step = 0.1, rate = 6,
      elementId = "player")
))
```
:::
